Package ohos.agp.components

Class ComponentProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.ComponentProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class ComponentProvider
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Provides remote components for cross-process display.

    This class provides a set of basic operations for modifying the content of remote components. It is commonly used for developing notifications displayed in the notification bar as well as widgets on the desktop or home screen.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  ComponentProvider.Action
      Describes actions that can be performed on remote components.
      static class  ComponentProvider.ComponentProviderException
      Throws an exception for an error that occurs during a remote component operation.

    • Field Detail

      • APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY

        public static final int APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY
        Applies all of the actions after a ComponentProvider object is updated.

        This allows the components to be updated in another application.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS

        public static final int APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS
        Inflates the layout and applies all of the actions after a ComponentProvider object is created.

        This allows the created components to be displayed in another application.

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setApplyType

        public boolean setApplyType​(int applyType)
        Sets the operation type.

        The operation type can be APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS or APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY. The APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS type means to inflate the layout and apply all of the actions, whereas the APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY type means to apply all of the actions only.

        Parameters:
        applyType - Indicates the operation type, which can only be APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS or APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY. A value other than these two will cause failure to invoke the current method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation type is set successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getApplyType

        public int getApplyType​()
        Obtains the operation type.
        Returns:
        Returns the operation type, which can be either APPLY_TYPE_LAYOUT_AND_ACTIONS or APPLY_TYPE_ACTIONS_ONLY.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        setApplyType(int)

      • setDefaultBundleName

        public void setDefaultBundleName​(String bundleName)
        Sets the default bundle name for obtaining resources.
        Parameters:
        bundleName - Indicates the bundle name to set. Before converting HarmonyOS resources into ones that can be identified by other systems, you need the bundle name to locate the HarmonyOS resources. If the bundle name is incorrect, HarmonyOS resources cannot be located, and the conversion will fail.
        Since:
        4

      • getDefaultBundleName

        public String getDefaultBundleName​()
        Obtains the default bundle name.
        Returns:
        Returns the default bundle name.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        setDefaultBundleName(String)

      • isValidComponentId

        public boolean isValidComponentId​(int componentId)
        Checks whether a component is valid based on the provided component ID.

        This method finds the ComponentProvider corresponding to the provided component ID.

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a component with the given ID is found; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        public void inflateLayout​(Context context)
        Inflates the layout based on layout definition.

        If the layout in ComponentProvider needs to be displayed, inflate the layout based on the Context of the application.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the Context of the current application.
        Since:

      • setTextSize

        public ComponentProvider.Action setTextSize​(int componentId,
                                            int size)
        Sets the text size for a component.

        This method is equivalent to Text#setTextSize(int). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        size - Indicates the text size.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:
        1

      • setTextSize

        public ComponentProvider.Action setTextSize​(int componentId,
                                            int size,
                                            Text.TextSizeType textSizeType)
        Sets the text size of the component.

        This method is equivalent to Text#setTextSize(int, ohos.agp.components.Text.TextSizeType). You need to call applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer) for the method to take effect.

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        size - Indicates the text size.
        textSizeType - Indicates the unit of the text size, as enumerated in Text.TextSizeType.
        Returns:
        Returns an Action object.
        Since:
        5

      • setTextColor

        public ComponentProvider.Action setTextColor​(int componentId,
                                             Color color)
        Sets the text color for a component.

        This method is equivalent to Text#setTextColor(Color). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        color - Indicates the text color to set to. For details, see the definitions in Color.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:
        1

      • setProgressBar

        public ComponentProvider.Action setProgressBar​(int componentId,
                                               int max,
                                               int progress,
                                               boolean indeterminate)
        Sets the progress of ProgressBar.

        This method is equivalent to ProgressBar#setMaxValue(int), ProgressBar#setProgressValue(int), and ProgressBar#setIndeterminate(boolean). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        max - Indicates the maximum value of the progress bar.
        progress - Indicates the current progress.
        indeterminate - Indicates whether the progress is indeterminate. true means that the progress is indeterminate; false means otherwise.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:
        1

      • setPadding

        public ComponentProvider.Action setPadding​(int componentId,
                                           int top,
                                           int bottom,
                                           int left,
                                           int right)
        Sets the padding for a component.

        This method is equivalent to Component#setPadding(int, int, int, int). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        top - Indicates the number of pixels for top padding.
        bottom - Indicates the number of pixels for bottom padding.
        left - Indicates the number of pixels for left padding.
        right - Indicates the number of pixels for right padding.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:
        1

      • setImagePixelMap

        public ComponentProvider.Action setImagePixelMap​(int componentId,
                                                 PixelMap pixelMap)
        Sets the image content for a component.

        This method is equivalent to Image#setPixelMap(PixelMap). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        pixelMap - Indicates the image content to set.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:
        3

      • setImageContent

        public ComponentProvider.Action setImageContent​(int componentId,
                                                int resId)
        Sets the content to be displayed on a specified image component.

        This method is equivalent toImage#setPixelMap(int). You need to call applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer) for the method to take effect.

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the ID of the image component.
        resId - Indicates the resource ID of the content to be displayed on the image component. The content can be an image in the PNG, SVG, or another applicable format.
        Returns:
        Returns an Action object.
        Since:
        5

      • setBackgroundPixelMap

        public ComponentProvider.Action setBackgroundPixelMap​(int componentId,
                                                      PixelMap pixelMap)
        Sets the background image of a component.

        This method is equivalent to Component#setBackground(Element). However, it requires that you manually invoke applyAction(ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer).

        Parameters:
        componentId - Indicates the component ID.
        pixelMap - Indicates the background image to set.
        Returns:
        Returns the Action object.
        Since:

                                               IntentAgent intent)
        Sets the IntentAgent object for a remote component.
        Parameters:

        intent - Indicates intent to use.
        Returns:
